userStories.title: Embed minimal mpv input.conf in Go binary
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a minimal mpv input configuration embedded in the binary so it can be written to disk at launch time without requiring external config files.
acceptanceCriteria: Create an input.conf file in the mpv/ package directory with exactly three bindings: space cycle pause, q quit, f cycle fullscreen
Embed the file using go:embed in the mpv package (in launch.go or a new config.go file)
The embedded content is accessible as a []byte or string variable
Typecheck passes (CGO_ENABLED=0 go vet ./...)

userStories.title: Launch mpv with disabled default keybindings and embedded input.conf
userStories.description: As a user, I want mpv to launch with only space, q, and f keybindings so I don't accidentally trigger disruptive actions like subtitle cycling or screenshots.
acceptanceCriteria: LaunchMpv() writes the embedded input.conf content to a temporary file (e.g. /tmp/tagging-rugby-input.conf or os.CreateTemp)
mpv is launched with --no-input-default-bindings flag to strip all built-in defaults
mpv is launched with --input-conf=<temp-file-path> pointing to the written config
The temp file is cleaned up when the mpv process exits or the app shuts down (best effort via defer os.Remove)
mpv only responds to space (pause), q (quit), and f (fullscreen) ‚Äî all other keys ignored by mpv
All existing IPC-based controls (seek, speed, mute, frame step, overlay, A-B loop) continue to work exactly as before
Typecheck passes (CGO_ENABLED=0 go vet ./...)
